greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product p(k)^e(k) then a(n) = {Product (p(k)+1)^e(k) - Product (p(k)-1)^e(k)}/2, a(1) = 0.
comment: a(n) = p+q iff n is biprime, i.e. n = pq, p <= q primes;
a(n) = (pq+pr+qr)+1 iff n is triprime, i.e. n = pqr, p <= q <= r primes;
a(n) = (pqr+pqs+prs+qrs)+(p+q+r+s) iff n is quadprime, i.e. n = pqrs, p <= q <= r <= s primes;
link: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100000
program: (PARI) a(n) = {f = factor(n); return ((prod(k=1, #f~, (f[k, 1]+1)^f[k, 2]) - prod(k=1, #f~, (f[k, 1]-1)^f[k, 2]))/2);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 13 2013
results.author: _Daniel Forgues_, Nov 18 2009
